00035 /**
00036  * MySQL database adapter.
00037  *
00038  * @category   ASOworx
00039  * @package    ASO
00040  * @copyright  Copyright (c) A Small Orange Software (http://www.asmallorange.com)
00041  * @license    http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php MIT License
00042  */
00043 class ASO_Db_MySQL extends ASO_Db_Abstract
00044 {
00045         /**
00046          * Connects to the defined server and selects the defined database. 
00047          *
00048          * Do not use directly. query() will connect the database if it has not been
00049          * connected already. This method allows the database layer to be instantiated
00050          * on every page without neccessarily requiring a database connection on each 
00051          * page.
00052          *
00053          * @return void
00054          */
00055         public function connect()
00056         {
00057         if( $this->_connection )
00058             return;
00059         
00060                 $this->_connection = @mysql_connect( $this->config['db_host'], 
00061                                                      $this->config['db_user'], 
00062                                                      $this->config['db_pass'] );
00063 
00064                 if ( !$this->_connection )
00065                 {
00066                         throw new ASO_Db_MySQL_Exception( "MySQL Error: " . mysql_error() );
00067                 }
00068 
00069                 if ( !mysql_select_db( $this->config['db_name'], $this->_connection ) )
00070         {
00071                         throw new ASO_Db_MySQL_Exception( "MySQL Error: " . mysql_error() );
00072         }
00073         }
00074 
00075         /**
00076          * Wrapper for mysql_close()
00077          * @return void
00078          */
00079         public function close()
00080         {
00081            mysql_close( $this->_connection );
00082            $this->_connection = null;
00083         }
00084 
00085         /**
00086          * Wrapper for mysql_query(). Expected to be called from _query()
00087          *
00088          * @param string $query_string The query string to run
00089          * @param boolean $no_debug Tells the function if it should record the query in the debug variables.
00090          * @return void
00091          */
00092         protected function _query( $query_string = "", $no_debug = false )
00093         {
00094                 $this->_queryid = @mysql_query( $query_string, $this->_connection );
00095                 
00096                 if( mysql_errno() != 0 )
00097             throw new ASO_Db_MySQL_Exception("Could not compete a query to the database. MySQL error: " . mysql_error() );
00098         }
00099 
00100         /**
00101          * Querys the db and gets one row.
00102          * @param string $query_string The query string to run
00103          * @param integer $no_debug Tells the function if it should record the query in the debug variables.
00104          * @return array The 1st row of the query
00105          */
00106         public function queryFetch( $query_string = "", $no_debug = 0 )
00107         {
00108                 $this->query( $query_string, $no_debug );
00109                 
00110                 if( mysql_num_rows( $this->_queryid ) > 0 )
00111                 {
00112                         return $this->fetch_assoc( $this->_queryid );
00113                 }
00114                 else
00115                 {
00116                         return array();
00117                 }
00118         }
00119         
00120         /**
00121          * Querys the db and gets all rows.
00122          * @param string $query_string The query string to run
00123          * @param integer $no_debug Tells the function if it should record the query in the debug variables.
00124          * @return array An array of all rows of the query
00125          */
00126     public function queryFetchAll( $query_string = "", $no_debug = 0 )
00127     {
00128         $this->query( $query_string, $no_debug );
00129         
00130                 if( mysql_num_rows( $this->_queryid ) > 0 )
00131                 {
00132                         $res = array();
00133                         while( $row = $this->fetch_assoc( $this->_queryid ) )
00134                                 $res[] = $row;
00135                         return $res;
00136                 }
00137                 else
00138                 {
00139                         return array();
00140                 }
00141     }
00142         
00143         /**
00144          * Inserts an array of data into a table
00145          * @param string $table The table to insert into
00146          * @param array $data The data to insert with keys as field names
00147          * @return resource The ID of the query
00148          */
00149         public function insert( $table = "", $data = array() )
00150         {   
00151                 $columns = '';
00152                 $values = '';
00153                 
00154                 foreach( $data as $key => $value )
00155                 {
00156             $value = mysql_real_escape_string( $value );
00157 
00158                         $columns .= " `$key`,";
00159                         $values  .= " '$value',";
00160                 }
00161                 
00162                 $columns = preg_replace( '/,$/', '', $columns );
00163                 $values  = preg_replace( '/,$/', '', $values );
00164                 
00165         return $this->query( "INSERT INTO $table( $columns ) VALUES ( $values )" );
00166         }
00167         
00168         /**
00169          * Replaces an array of data in a table or creates a new row
00170          * @param string $table The table to replace info
00171          * @param array $data The data to replace with keys as field names
00172          * @return resource The ID of the query
00173          */
00174         public function replace( $table = "", $data = array() )
00175         {   
00176                 $columns = '';
00177                 $values = '';
00178                 
00179                 foreach( $data as $key => $value )
00180                 {
00181             $value = mysql_real_escape_string( $value );
00182 
00183                         $columns .= " `$key`,";
00184                         $values  .= " '$value',";
00185                 }
00186                 
00187                 $columns = preg_replace( '/,$/', '', $columns );
00188                 $values  = preg_replace( '/,$/', '', $values );
00189                 
00190         return $this->query( "REPLACE INTO $table( $columns ) VALUES ( $values )" );
00191         }
00192         
00193         /**
00194          * Updates a row of data in a table
00195          * @param string $table The table to update
00196          * @param array $data The data to update to with keys as field names
00197          * @param string $id_field The field on which to match the row to update
00198          * @param mixed $id The id of that field
00199          * @return resource The ID of the query
00200          */
00201         public function update( $table = "", $data = array(), $id_field, $id )
00202         {   
00203         $setters = '';
00204                 foreach( $data as $key => $value )
00205                 {
00206             $value = mysql_real_escape_string( $value );
00207                         $setters .= " `$key`='$value',";
00208                 }
00209                 
00210                 $setters = preg_replace( '/,$/' , ' ' , $setters );
00211                             
00212                 return $this->query( "UPDATE $table SET " . $setters . "WHERE `$id_field` = '$id'" );
00213         }
00214         
00215         /**
00216          * Wrapper for mysql_fetch_array().
00217          * @param resource $queryid The query ID to use for this operation
00218          * @return array The data from the current row.
00219          */
00220         public function fetch_array( $queryid = -1 )
00221         {
00222                 if( $queryid == -1 )
00223                         $queryid = $this->_queryid;
00224 
00225                 return mysql_fetch_array( $queryid );
00226         }
00227 
00228         /**
00229          * Wrapper for mysql_fetch_assoc()
00230          * @param resource $queryid The query ID to use for this operation
00231          * @return array The data from the current row
00232          */
00233         public function fetch_assoc( $queryid = -1 )
00234         {
00235                 if( $queryid == -1 )
00236                         $queryid = $this->_queryid;
00237 
00238                 return mysql_fetch_assoc( $queryid );
00239         }
00240 
00241         /**
00242          * Wrapper for mysql_data_seek()
00243          * @param resource $queryid The query ID to use for this operation
00244          * @param integer $row Thw row to seek data to
00245          * @return resource The query ID
00246          */
00247         public function data_seek( $queryid, $row )
00248         {
00249                 if( $queryid == -1 )
00250                         $queryid = $this->_queryid;
00251 
00252                 return mysql_data_seek( $queryid, $row );
00253         }

00255         /**
00256          * Wrapper for mysql_num_rows()
00257          * @param resource $queryid The query ID to use for this operation
00258          * @return int The number of selected rows
00259          */
00260         public function num_rows( $queryid = -1 )
00261         {
00262                 if( $queryid == -1 )
00263                         $queryid = $this->_queryid;
00264                         
00265                 return mysql_num_rows( $queryid );
00266         }

00268         /**
00269          * Wrapper for mysql_affected_rows()
00270          * @param resource $connectid The connection ID to use for this operation
00271          * @return int The number of affected rows
00272          */
00273         public function affected_rows( $queryid = -1 )
00274         {
00275                 if( $queryid == -1 )
00276                         $queryid = $this->_queryid;
00277 
00278                 return mysql_affected_rows( $queryid );
00279         }

00281         /**
00282          * Wrapper for mysql_insert_id()
00283          * @return int The id of the last inserted row
00284          */
00285         public function insert_id()
00286         {
00287                 return mysql_insert_id( $this->_connection );
00288         }
00289 
00290         /**
00291          * Grab all the data from a table. Makes for easy coding. 
00292          * @param string $table The name of the table to pull from
00293          * @param int $limit The number of rows to limit the results to
00294          * @param int $offset The offset of the row to start from
00295          * @return array The data from the table
00296          */
00297     public function getAll( $table, $limit = 0, $offset = 0 )
00298     {
00299         //--------------------------------
00300         // Check if we're using a limit
00301         // The offset can be 0, since 
00302         // it's equivalent with or without
00303         //--------------------------------
00304         
00305         $sqllimit = '';
00306         if( $limit > 0 )
00307                 {
00308                         $offset = intval( $offset ) < 0 ? 0 : intval( $offset );
00309                         
00310             $sqllimit = "LIMIT $offset, $limit";
00311                 }
00312         
00313         //-----------------------------
00314         // Do some serious data suction
00315         //-----------------------------
00316         
00317         $res = array();
00318         $this->query( "SELECT * FROM $table $sqllimit" );
00319         while( $row = $this->fetch_array() )
00320             $res[] = $row;
00321             
00322         return $res;
00323     }
00324 
00325         /**
00326          * Paginate data from the table.
00327          * @param string $table The name of the table to pull from
00328          * @param int $limit The number of rows per page
00329          * @param int $page The page we're on right now
00330          * @return array The data from the table and the total pages there are
00331          */
00332     public function getByPage( $table, $limit = 0, $page = 0, $where = '' )
00333     {
00334                 $where = empty( $where ) ? '' : "WHERE $where";
00335         
00336                 //-------------------------------------------------------------------
00337                 // I realize these lines may be a bit confusing, so let me explain...
00338                 // Since data starts at 0, you have to subtract 1 from the page 
00339                 // count. But you have to add one when dividing to get the total
00340                 // number of pages. Confusing? Yes, but it works.
00341                 //-------------------------------------------------------------------
00342         
00343                 $count = array_pop( $this->queryFetch( "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM $table $where" ) );
00344         
00345                 return array( 'data'  => $this->getAll( $table." ".$where, $limit, ( $page - 1 ) * $limit ),
00346                                           'count' => $count,
00347                                           'pages' => round( $count / $limit ) + 1 );
00348         }
00349     
00350         /**
00351          * Grab an entry from a table.
00352          * @param string $table The name of the table to pull from
00353          * @param string $id A WHERE condition to match
00354          * @return array The item from the table
00355          */
00356     public function get( $table, $where )
00357     {
00358         return $this->queryFetch( "SELECT * FROM $table WHERE $where" );
00359     }
00360     
00361         /**
00362          * Grab the enumeration/set values from a table for a specific field.
00363          * @param string $table The name of the table to pull from
00364          * @param string $field The field to pull from
00365          * @return array The values that make up the enumeration
00366          */
00367         function enum_values( $table, $field ) {
00368                 $row = $this->queryFetch( "SHOW COLUMNS FROM `{$table}` LIKE '{$field}'" );
00369                 preg_match_all( "/'(.*?)'/" , $row["Type"], $enum_array );
00370                 $enum_fields = $enum_array[1];
00371                 return $enum_fields;
00372         }
00373         
00374         /**
00375          * Grab the unique values from a table for a specific field.
00376          * @param string $table The name of the table to pull from
00377          * @param string $field The field to pull from
00378          * @return array The unique values that make up the field
00379          */
00380         function unique_values( $table, $field ) {
00381                 $res = $this->queryFetchAll( "SELECT DISTINCT {$field} FROM {$table} WHERE {$field} IS NOT NULL ORDER BY {$field}" );
00382                 $return = array();
00383                 foreach ( $res as $r ) {
00384                         $return[] = $r[ $field ];
00385                 }
00386                 return $return;
00387         }
00388     
00389     /**
00390      * Returns the string representation of the object
00391      *
00392      * @return string
00393      */
00394     public function __toString() {
00395         $out = "<pre>";
00396         $out .= "Database Object\n";
00397         $out .= "{\n";
00398         $out .= "\t[connected] => ".( $this->_connection == null ? "false" : "true" )."\n";
00399         
00400         $out .= "\t[last_query] => ".$this->query."\n";
00401         $out .= "\t[querycount] => ".$this->querycount."\n";
00402         $out .= "\t[querytimes] => ".str_replace( array( "\n", "    " ), array( "", "" ), print_r( $this->querytimes, true ) )."\n";
00403         $out .= "\t[querylist] => ".str_replace( array( "\n", "    " ), array( "", "" ), print_r( $this->querylist, true ) )."\n";
00404 
00405         $out .= "}\n";
00406         $out .= "</pre>";
00407         return $out;
00408     }
